    Research Papers

    Paper titles are links to the abstract, pdf, and replication material.

    Peer-reviewed publications

    Estimation and Forecasting of Large Realized Covariance Matrices and Portfolio Choice.

    • Joint work with Anders B. Kock and Marcelo C. Medeiros.
    • Journal of Applied Econometrics.

    Regularized Estimation of Structural Instability in Factor Models: The US Macroeconomy and the Great Moderation.

    • Joint work with Johannes Tang Kristensen.
    • Advances in Econometrics vol. 35, Dynamic Factor Models.

    Sharp threshold detection based on sup-norm error rates in high-dimensional models

    • Joint work with Mehmet Caner, Anders Bredahl Kock, and Juan Andres Riquelme.
    • Journal of Business and Economic Statistics, 2015.

    Deterministic and stochastic trends in the Lee-Carter mortality model.

    • Joint work with Niels Haldrup, Malene Kallestrup Lamb.
    • Applied Economics Letters, 2015.

    Oracle inequalities for high dimensional vector autoregressions.

    • Joint work with Anders Bredahl Kock.
    • Journal of Econometrics, Volume 186, Issue 2, June 2015.

    Oracle Efficient estimation and Forecasting with the Adaptive Lasso and the Adaptive Group Lasso in Vector Autoregressions.

    • Joint work with Anders Bredahl Kock.
    • Essays in Nonlinear Time Series Econometrics, Chapter 10, Oxford University Press, 2014.

    Working papers

    A Nodewise Regression Approach to Estimating Large Portfolios.

    • Joint work with Mehmet Caner, Esra Ulasan, Özlem Önder.
    • Submitted

    Vector Autoregressions with Parsimoniously Time-Varying Parameters and an Application to Monetary Policy.

    • Joint work with Johannes Tang Kristensen.
    • Submitted.

    Estimating and Testing for a Common Co-Integration Space in Large Panels of Co-Integrated VARs.

    • Working Paper.

    A Bootstrap Co-Integration Rank Test for Panels of Co-Integrated VARs.

    • Working paper.

    Work in progress

    • Forecasting USD/EUR exchange rates with high dimensional estimators, with Mehmet Caner.
    • Dynamic panels with multiple ordinal dimensions.
    • Country level effects of Monetary policy and prices dynamics in the Euro-zone, with Anders B. Kock.
    • Inference in models with parsimoniously time-varying parameters.
